title: Augusta County: Lettie R. Smiley to Thomas M. Smiley, August 11, 1862
summary: Lettie R. Smiley worries about the troops moving in the heat, and discusses local news including hay harvest, milling, church sermons, illnesses, and a case of mistaken desertion.
keywords: Agriculture, Church/Religious Activities, Death/ Casualties, Desertion/Leave, Home Front, Medicine/Hospitals, Military Authority, Troop Movement, American Civil War
